title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 June 2014 - XWiki
content:
<D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
01:18 <polx> has quit  
02:49 <Lyes> has quit  
06:41 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:12 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:37 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki

08:05 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <mflorea> has quit  
08:36 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <vierfzweievieraz> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <lucaa> has quit  
08:54 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: hi, about that rendering cache pull request... should i process those comments? (i guess restructure whole patch according to xwiki standards?)  
09:35 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: if your apply the comments I would certainly apply the pull request, for the last one making RenderingCacheAware more a component as I suggested should be enough to apply it  
09:39 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, will do that  
09:39 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: thanks !  
09:39 <DarkKnightCZ> no problem  
09:43 <DarkKnightCZ> by the way, anybody knows what security restriction forbids from using xpage=resubmit in url? (Tomcat)  
09:57 <polx> has quit  
09:59 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <DarkKnightCZ> nevermind, it's chrome problem  
10:38 <polx> has quit  
10:43 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <tmortagne> vmassol, Lyes: what is the status of new mail module merge ?  
10:47 <vmassol> tmortagne: I need about 2 hours more I think  
10:47 <tmortagne> ok  
10:47 <tmortagne> release this afternoon then I guess  
10:47 <vmassol> if possible yes thanks  
10:49 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <Lyes> has left #xwiki  
10:59 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'll need your help to copy the history from contrib to platform too :)  
11:08 <vmassol> (not right now)  
11:09 <tmortagne> this remind me that I see to reinstall git subtree  
11:15 <ClemensR> has quit  
11:22 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <evalica> has quit  
12:11 <Slashman> hello, I'm trying to create a group that can only read xwiki and not do anything else, I have created a group "readers" and given it only the "view" right and it still can edit everything, I have removed every rights from "XWiki.XWikiAllGroup" except the "view" right, still same issue, I have then forbidden the "edit/register/comment" right on the "readers" group and they can still edit everything, any help?  
12:12 <ClemensR> that is strange. it should be enough to forbid the "edit" right for the readers group  
12:14 <Slashman> ClemensR: never mind, I accidentally added my test user to the wrong group, sorry  
12:14 <ClemensR> ah, thats why :)  
12:14 <Slashman> :p  
12:41 <webczat> How to check what pages have programming rithts?  
12:41 <polx> has quit  
12:41 <ClemensR> that depends on which users have programming rights ...  
12:42 <ClemensR> this might make up an interesting XWQL  query ...  
12:43 <webczat> I actuallu meant a database query, it is easier in my case. I saved few pages as admin and not sure if they went insecure.  
12:45 <webczat> Or they are checked for use of protected api?  
12:49 <webczat> or it is just the name of  the user that last modified it?  
12:54 <ClemensR> it is the last "contentAuthor" of the document  
12:56 <webczat> So I am safe from other users?  
12:56 <ClemensR> in plain SQL it is something like select XWD\_FULLNAME from xwikidoc  where XWD\_CONTENT\_AUTHOR='XWiki.Admin';  
12:56 <ClemensR> if you know it is only the admin who changed things  
12:56 <webczat> If someone else did then the content author changes and page loses rights, am I right?  
12:57 <ClemensR> I have to admit that an SQL query that checks which users have programming rights .... is a bit too mindboggeling to me  
12:57 <webczat> :D  
12:57 <webczat> I am actually just trying to check if I'm safe  
12:57 <ClemensR> yes, is another user  (without programming rights)  edits the content of the page, it no longer works  
12:58 <ClemensR> s/is/if/  
12:58 <webczat> Okay. The query is not needed then if that works in that way.  
12:59 <webczat> btwm is XWiki scripting reference doc up to date?  
12:59 <ClemensR> there are some kind of "secure scripts" coming up, where normal users can edit the page, as long as they leave the "programing rights scripts" alone  
12:59 <ClemensR> but for now it just fails if someone changes anything on the page, to be on the safe side  
12:59 <ClemensR> SRD is still 5.0 , so it is not exactly up to date  
13:01 <webczat> So how to check the usage of things? I can get classes from javadoc, but I do not have any access to up to date object list for velocity  
13:02 <ClemensR> I have to admit I am a bit afraid of updating the thing there ...  
13:03 <ClemensR> there have not been any big chnages to the API, especially there should not have been any removals, so it is still ok unelss you want to use someing brand new  
13:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: We're ready to make the move  
13:04 <vmassol> from contrib to platform  
13:04 <vmassol> :)  
13:04 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-platform-mail  
13:05 <vmassol> do you think you help me perform this move to keep the history?  
13:05 <vmassol> s/help/could help/  
13:08 <Slashman> hello again, I have removed the "blog" extension on a new xwiki and it removed the search field, any idea how I can get it back?  
13:11 <vierfzweievieraz> has left #xwiki  
13:22 <ClemensR> blog should not remove the search :(  
13:22 <Slashman> ClemensR: my colleague deleted the Main space in fact...  
13:22 <ClemensR> ah, ok, thats why  
13:23 <ClemensR> I recommend http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/RestoreSpace   unsurprisingly  
13:23 <Slashman> ClemensR: what a mess...  
13:23 <ClemensR> to get the "Main" space back  
13:24 <Slashman> we restored it with the default ui but a lot of macro re missing now  
13:24 <ClemensR> and I should get XWIKI-8320  done some day :/  
13:25 <ClemensR> hm, who restored the default ui and how ?  
13:26 <Slashman> ClemensR: do you have any advice to set up a light xwiki for documentation, we want our customer to access xwiki and only see a minimal UI (custom side panel, etc)? before we break xwiki completely  
13:26 <Slashman> restored from the previous revision or something  
13:27 <Slashman> there was no custom macro, I'm missing the defaults ones like: "Unknown macro: spaces"  
13:27 <ClemensR> hm, if they are not admins, they should not be able to delete too much  
13:27 <Slashman> well at the moment we are trying to set up xwiki like we want  
13:28 <ClemensR> hm, the macro is not listed on the XWiki.WikiMacros space ?  
13:28 <Slashman> bin/view/Main/SpaceIndex?space=XWiki.WikiMacros ?  
13:28 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
13:28 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
13:29 <Slashman> it's empty  
13:29 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
13:30 <ClemensR> if you want to customize the menus, it might mean writing your own skin (me trying to find the docs for that)  
13:30 <ClemensR> bin/view/XWiki/WikiMacros shows the list of macro pages  
13:30 <webczat> Where is the list of all macros like those that are not pages?  
13:32 <ClemensR> um, I thought these cannot be trashed ... but I guess these are not listed by an xwiki page, but you need to check with the corresponding service ...  
13:33 <Slashman> so what happened is that when you go to a space that doesn't exist anymore, if you try to delete it, it deletes the "Main" space  
13:33 <Slashman> he tried to delete a space already deleted  
13:34 <ClemensR> ah, that should not happen, if you can reproduce that I think this is a bug .... people would just need to double click in the remove button for that to happen  
13:35 <ClemensR> btw: Skin creation guide found:    http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Skins  
13:37 <Slashman> can we delete the "sandbox" space without a cataclysm? :p  
13:37 <ClemensR> Slashman: the "spaces" macro should be at  xwiki/bin/view/Main/Spaces   ... can you check if the page is there, and see who as eduited it ?  
13:38 <Slashman> ClemensR: thank you for your extension, we restored everything for main  
13:38 <ClemensR> yes, Sandbox can go away, it is just mentioned in the Quick Links panel  
13:38 <ClemensR> ah, phew, glad to hear  that this helped  
13:40 <bouquetf> has quit  
13:41 <tmortagne> vmassol: done  
13:41 <tmortagne> I hope  
13:43 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
13:46 <bouquetf> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
14:02 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <tmortagne> so what do we do about XWIKI-10446  
14:05 <tmortagne> is it really a recent regression ?  
14:05 <tmortagne> looking at the title it looks like a page requiring PR  
14:07 <vmassol> tmortagne: we fix it for 5.4.6 and 6.1RC1?  
14:08 <tmortagne> if the issue is a page requiring PR then we have a lot of blockers...  
14:10 <vmassol> still we need to fix this for 5.4.6 and 6.1RC1 IMO  
14:10 <vmassol> but I wouldn't delay 6.1M2 for it since we should have released 6.1M2 5 days ago already  
14:10 <tmortagne> so we need to make sure we fix all pages that require PR then  
14:11 <vmassol> we don't know if that's the problem  
14:12 <vmassol> but if it is the problem then yes we need to find some way to make it work  
14:12 <tmortagne> wee "<fature> does not work on a subwiki created with a normal user" can be applied to any of theses pages  
14:12 <tmortagne> document index require PR AFAIK for example  
14:12 <vmassol> yes, this needs to be tested too  
14:13 <vmassol> it's a pity Denis has not finished yet  
14:13 <vmassol> his signed script is just slightly late for this  
14:13 <vmassol> :)  
14:15 <tmortagne> looks like evalica forgot to set the documentation field in all issues she closed  
14:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: XWIKI-10373 for you  
14:16 <tmortagne> is the mail issue closed ?  
14:16 <tmortagne> msmeria: same for you, 3 issue in http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%226.1-milestone-2%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Fixed%22%29%20and%20%28%28Documentation%20is%20EMPTY%29%20or%20%28%22Documentation%20in%20Release%20Notes%22%20is%20EMPTY%29%29  
14:17 <tmortagne> vmassol, Lyes: XWIKI-10405 need to be closed and documented  
14:17 <vmassol> yep  
14:17 <vmassol> handling it  
14:19 <vmassol> tmortagne: should I delete the contribi repo for mail now?  
14:20 <vmassol> (I think so)  
14:20 <tmortagne> if all is ok in platform yes  
14:20 <vmassol> the history seems to be there  
14:20 <vmassol> removing  
14:23 <msmeria> tmortagne: done  
14:31 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: can you hold on the release for 5 more minutes? :)  
14:35 <tmortagne> sure  
14:35 <vmassol> done  
14:35 <vmassol> thanks  
14:35 <tmortagne> platform is still building on jenkins anyway  
14:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: I need to add the parameters in xwiki.properties.vm  
14:48 <kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <kaisen> Hello  
14:59 <vmassol> tmortagne:  testing the mail module for real now, please hold on a little bit...  
14:59 <tmortagne> updating the translations  
15:01 <msmeria> has quit  
15:10 <vmassol> fixing bug  
15:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: trying to understand why the following returns a String and not an Integer:  
15:12 <vmassol>         return this.documentsSource.getProperty("smtp\_port",  
15:12 <vmassol> this.xwikiPropertiesSource.getProperty(PREFIX + "port", 25)  
15:12 <vmassol> returns an Integer  
15:13 <tmortagne> maybe documentsSource does not take into account passed default type and only the object property type  
15:14 <vmassol> trying to go around it by doing in 2 steps  
15:15 <tmortagne> why not making the property an int ?  
15:15 <vmassol> wdym?  
15:15 <vmassol> cast?  
15:15 <tmortagne> no  
15:15 <tmortagne> I mean in the xclass  
15:16 <vmassol> I haven't changed that  
15:16 <tmortagne> yes and I suggest you to change it  
15:16 <tmortagne> you could also fix the document source to take the default value type into account  
15:17 <vmassol> I'm in a hurry here  
15:17 <vmassol> we need to release  
15:25 <vmassol> ok works, committing  
15:26 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok it's good from my side  
15:28 <tmortagne> ok  
15:28 <tmortagne> not sure if I will have time to fully finish the release today but should be ok for the maven/git release  
15:30 <tmortagne> starting commons release  
15:36 <vmassol> sorry....  
15:42 <Slashman> is there a way to prevent members of a group from changing their password?  
15:44 <vmassol> going for lunch, bbiab  
16:22 <woshilapin> has quit  
16:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: why are you putting N/A for improvements?  
16:39 <vmassol> they need to be documented  
16:40 <vmassol> could you please remove them?  
16:40 <vmassol> because we're going to miss lots of documentation  
16:43 <motofix> has joined #xwiki  
16:45 <motofix> Hello, I do not found xwiki-platform-oldcore artefact in search.maven.org, and I obviously need it to create a Custom authentication (http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HCustomAuthentication) Is there a new artefact?  
16:46 <vmassol> it's on maven central  
16:46 <vmassol> please read http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
16:46 <vmassol> s/on/not  
16:46 <vmassol> actually:  
16:46 <vmassol> s/on/not on  
16:46 <vmassol> (motofix)  
16:46 <tmortagne> vmassol: so I stop the release and wait for evalica to document those issue ?  
16:47 <vmassol> nope  
16:47 <vmassol> don't stop  
16:47 <vmassol> but don't tick it as green  
16:47 <vmassol> in the plan  
16:47 <vmassol> it needs to be finished  
16:47 <vmassol> I've pinged caty already  
16:47 <vmassol> she's offline ATM  
16:48 <motofix> Thanks vmassol, got it.  
16:59 <tmortagne> git/maven release done  
16:59 <vmassol> cool
